reviews.review_text: This place is everything about how sushi should be like! They make their own Wasabi in traditional style, use fresh, and choose not to over do the flavor. They cook their Tamago, the egg omelet sushi themselves, unlike some sushi places buy from market. Their Tamayo is very uniquely flavored with strong fragrance. Their Toro tastes buttery, and their octopus is actually soft. Unlike some octopus from other sushi restaurants that taste like chewy rubber. They proudly showcase the fresh, raw taste and texture of each ingredient with delicate seasonings. Service is great, and you get your food served fast. If theres a reason why they only open for 3 hours a day, it would probably be that they want to offer a high quality of restaurant experience. Definitely recommend.
Superb sushi. I ordered wild sockeye salmon don. They put lots of quality sashimi. Wasabi was strong and real. Definitely coming back here. 20.50$.

Great quality sushi! A little bit more pricey than other places but the quality of the sushi and sashimi more than makes up for the differences. Service is a little slow especially when they are busy but would recommend them, especially for take out!
best Teriyaki so far in Vancouver very good service and atmosphere I tried the California roll and it was good I had the best in Malaysia Food : 5/5 |

I cant believe weve lived so close for so long, and this was the first time we actually went! What a wonderful, small, traditional sushi restaurant. The prices were so reasonable for the quality of food - the salmon, roe, prawns, and tuna were incredibly fresh. I had been looking for a restaurant nearby with sashimi, and Kazu delivered. We already know what to order next (the squid must be good since it was sold out) - we cant wait to come back and try more, soon!

Good quality Japanese food in an understated setting. They even use real wasabi! Price is reasonable when compared to other restaurants offering this quality of food. Service is excellent and we are always made to feel welcome.
Very good sushi with fresh prawn, salmon. Portion of Seaweed salad is quite small, and nothing is special.

Authentic Japanese restaurant in Burnaby. Excellent and fresh food and tea, beautifully presented! One of the best sushi and sashimi I ever had, with real wasabi and ultra fresh fish! The chef and staff are very welcoming, attentive and talented. Arigat , merci!
We eat at Kazu at least once a month because of the quality. My all time favourite sushi place! Love their fresh wasabi too.
Well priced good and fresh sushi. Charashi don was delicious! Sometimes they are super busy and sometimes its quiet. Make a reso just in case!

One of the best authentic Japanese sushi  restaurant in town.  Fresh ingredients, top notch Japanese cuisine from Japanese owned restaurant.  None of these Korean hybrid sushi joints thats trending.  Do try to notice the difference.  Youre going there for the food.

Love it here! Fresh sashimi Japanese owned. Traditional comfort food. Seasonal selections. Hot pot in the winter. Summer salad in the summer but u can order any of these year round. I discovered the crunch roll here and it s delicious! I can t get enough of It. Freshly grated wasabi horseradish. Friendly staff. When u sit by the bar kazu s sidekick will usually make conversation.

Great sushi spot along the Heights. Food is presented very well and in reasonable portions in relation to price. Staff are attentive and it definitely shows in the food and hospitality. Their karaage chicken is very good, highly recommend to add to your order.

An authentic Japanese restaurant is a rare find these days in metro Vancouver. To find one in the Heights, a sleepy enclave in North Burnaby is even more rare. For me, there is no better way to judge a Japanese restaurant than by its Chirashi Don, a colourful assortment of fresh seafood artfully arranged on a bed of sushi rice. The Chirashi at Kazu is definitely high-quality with a standard selection of seafood that included sockeye salmon, maguro, saba, ika, tako, masago and tobiko. I wish they offered a deluxe option with some ikura and uni. Also, ordered some amaebi sushi; they served the heads, deep fried, sprinkled with salt without asking. The deep fried heads were a treat. The Chirashi is a little pricier but definitely worth the premium for a little slice of Japan. Highly, highly recommend Kazu for fresh, high-quality seafood without any of the upscale restaurant prices.

Wow, an authentic Japanese place is a rare find, but North Burnaby seems to have a small concentration of great, Japanese-run Japanese restaurants. This is one of my favourites. Some of the dishes here I havent had anywhere else, and everything I have had here has been delicious. It is more neighbourhood than downtown, and reservations are recommended in order to avoid a wait.

The only thing I can say that needs improvement is that it needs to be open more!  I ordered the Chirashi Don which was probably the best Ive had in Vancouver so far! Highly recommend this place. Japanese run.

My favourite sushi place in Burnaby. Kazu-sans sushi and seafood is always fresh and tasty, and the chirashi don is one of the best ways to sample it first hand. Nabeyaki udon is my favourite go to dish in fall/winter, and the wife loves the grilled mackerel all year round.

Came here with some friends. Its usually busy on the weekends, weekdays at 5pm is usually when you can still get a table. I had the ankake tofu and friends had the ten zaru soba. Both are really good. Service is good, all the staff are Japanese so the food is very authentic.
Great sushi with very friendly staff, will definitely come back for a second round.
Owned and operated by the chef, who you can see making the sushi behind the counter. A little bit more expensive compared to your regular sushi joint, but quality is vastly superior.
Everything here is so fresh and so good!! Best sushi restaurant in Burnaby
Hands down! This place is awesome. Being run by Japanese staff and chefs. One of the best sushish I have had so far. Reminds me of the quality I had last year in Japan! 100% recommended!

Place has decent and fresh sushi. Can get crowded as it s a small place here in Burnaby. Coming early helps(opens at 5pm) but make sure you don t park on the South side of Hasting Street as it s no parking till 6pm. The North side is fine to park anytime after the morning.
Easily one of the best, lowkey sushi restaurants in the GVA. Tucked away and unassuming, but the quality is insane. I love this spot!
Very fresh and authentic Japanese sushi

Excellent fish quality , very tasty. One of the rate places that serves real wasabi. Our favorite among all the fish we tasted was the eel (other were great as well). Nice hospitality. A little small location be sure to make a reservation.
One of the best Japanese spots in town. I was particularly impressed by the freshness of the eel and mackeral. Real wasabi too!
A busy little authentic Japanese restaurant with fresh Japanese food, even the miso soup and the wasabi taste different.  Busy with the local Japanese customers which is always a good thing.

One of my favourite neighbourhood sushi places. Everything is very fresh and tasty. The chefs are highly skilled. (Ill go through my photo albums later for additional photos of items Ive ordered.) Sashimi, nigiri, and traditional maki rolls are a must-order item. My favourite item here is the Kazu Roll, which has the tight amount of sashimi featuring in a perfect sized roll.
One of the best real Japanese restaurants in North Burnaby. Extremely high quality and freshness made by real Japanese chef.
Legit.  Not your average sushi joint. Its proper. High quality, fresh, made with pride. Wasabi is the real deal. Had the deluxe assorted sushi and subbed the Cali roll to a spicy negihama roll. Yee!
This place is so authentic. It is owned by Japanese. I will visit again!
Ordered the deluxe assorted sushi combo. Tasted great. As others have said, fresh wasabi is used. Not sure what is their difference is but the sushi feels more authentic than other places.
Great Japanese restaurant. Servers are very friendly and refill tea often. Food has good portion and taste is quite authentic. Love the Nabeyaki udon, delicious broth!
I come back after many years. Still the same service and quality I remember. Very few times I actually find a Japanese owned sushi restaurant among so many of other foreign owned.
It s so great to have an authentic Japanese restaurant in Burnaby Heights!
Authentic Japanese restaurant. Sashimi was very fresh and sushi was well made by Japanese sushi chefs. Visit places like Kazu if youre looking for high quality sushi.

Really great dishes for a decent price! Ive tried pretty much every roll offered here as well as many entrees. Food quality is always consistent and great. Service is fantastic. Theres frequent refills of tea and you never feel rushed. Favorite dishes: katsudon, chopped scallop roll / nigiri, chicken karaage, tuna and salmon sashimi, negitoro roll / nigiri The weekend lunch specials are also extremely tasty!

Definitely one of the best places for authentic sushi in Metro Vancouver! Ingredients are all fresh and are of high quality. Quaint and calm atmosphere with very friendly staff. Make sure to reserve as the place is quite small.

Kazu is, without a doubt, one of the best sushi restaurants in Burnaby. Service is friendly. Sushi is prepared very well.  Whoever is deep frying in the back is an artist. Ive taken 3 different friend/ family groups here over the years and all were impressed. You will be too.

Ive been to lots of sushi spots and this is definitely on of the top places Ive been. For the value and quality its a must visit. -customer service was on point, we were greeted when we walked in, server/hostess was warm and friendly -sushi was FRESH -sushi rice was well done -I never eat Wasabi but this Wasabi was made in house and tasted really good -the ginger they had was also fresh and complimented the sushi well -service was fast, we ordered take out and only waited 10mins (the resturant was fully packed with customers) many thanks to the chef for working so quickly Highly recommend this spot!

Small sushi restaurant a little off the beaten track on Hastings Street in Burnaby, but worth making a trip for the freshest and tastiest sushi I have found in the Lower Mainland. I ordered all of my favorite Nigiri dishes and every one was excellent. So I can heartily recommend the Maguro, Sake, Hamachi, Uni, Unagi, Ikura, Saba and Toro. That was 16 pieces of heaven, washed down with Asahi Dry. I eat there with family every time I visit Vancouver.

One of my favourite Japanese places in Vancouver. Super lucky to have this gem in North Burnaby. As previously posted, authentic Japanese sushi chef makes the most wonderful sushi, edo style with no frills, just really tasty, fresh fish. The prices are a bit on the pricer side, but I think its worth the value. Ive visited multiple times and have never had a poor experience here.

High quality sockeye salmon thats tastier than other restaurants. The scallops and prawns are also super tasty. The fresh wasabi is so good. Cost slightly more than a generic Japanese restaurant, but definitely worth it. Staff is nice too. We got our teacups filled 3 times without asking.

Was not originally planning to go here but the other place was take out only. Family of 5 for dinner.  Atmosphere is small and simple but clean.  Food was excellent but our orders came out one after another so we didn t really eat at the same time. But the food was excellent, hot, fresh and some of the best sushi. Fresh wasabi was a nice touch. Some of the portions were a little small eg edamame, salmon sashimi but other meals were good. All hot meals were very fresh as was the sushi. Service was good but as mentioned before a little slow which was probably  because we were a party of 5.  Would definitely go again but probably with a smaller party.  Definitely more authentic vs your typical high volume place.

Ive had Kazu several times over the last year, throughout the pandemic. Their food is incredible, and is one of the best sushi restaurants in Burnaby/Vancouver hands down. I m so grateful to have them in the neighborhood and love going back for such well made, delicately crafted sushi. Thank you Chef!
Authentic Japanese food. Nice atmosphere. Good music. Great toro.

Perhaps the quality of the fish is not as impeccable as the sushi restaurant on the other end of North Burnaby, Kazu offers sushi in an affordable pricing with good cuts. The chefs strength is on traditional nigiri such as Toro, Hamachi, Aji. Meanwhile the nigiri and maki is good, the fusion rolls is passable. It also have a wide variety of hot meals to choose from, that will satisfy people who likes sizable portions and fullness. Nevertheless, they dont stand out as much as the sushi. I would recommend this restaurant as a daily / weekend go-to for families.

Having eaten at most of the Sushi restaurants in this area, I can say without a doubt that Kazus Chicken Teriyaki is clearly better than the rest - Sushi Uomo and Osaka sushi and Hiro, etc.  Their assorted sushi is as good if not better than Take. The rice they use for their sushi is great quality, not compressed and cheap quality that you find at some of the other sushi restaurants.   Next on my list to try out is their Udon and sashimi, but based on their track record I am confident that it will be top notch as well.  Their only downside (if you can consider it a downside) is that this is the worst kept secret in town - they are very popular on Fridays and Saturdays, you will wait up to an hour for your takeout order, so be prepared to plan around that.

Been here 3 times now and the food and service is consistently good. The menu is pretty authentic with some choices not found at your Korean or Chinese run sushi joints. Only small downside would be the street parking which can be scare depending on time & day. As a Bby resident, it was cool to see they have a roll named the North Burnaby Roll :)

Great place ! Small and nothing extravagant but  staff is great and for the most important point sushi is bang on. Best place for authentic sushi and taste. If I make my gf mad I m coming here to give her a taste of home and comfort to smooth stuff over. Heard a rumour that the owners sun works at the docks to ensure the freshest food they can get. But thats just a rumour so don t quote me. Recommend the  Crazy Burnaby Roll  or the Kama if you like that sort of stuff. If your date is Japanese impress her and impress your wallet here. It s on my favourites list.
Not bad! Friendly and authentic!
Fresh and authentic Japanese cuisine, hidden gem in North Burnaby.
One of the best, if not the best sushi restaurant in Burnaby. I always order their nigiri sushi. Top quality and authentic Japanese food.

One of the better sushi places around. If Im not mistaken, probably one of the only places I know that uses real wasabi. Fibres are usually visible and it differs from the horseradish in that the spiciness doesnt really linger and not as overwhelming. Portions are on the smaller side and prices may be slightly more than others. Strongly recommend to check out, chefs are genuinely Japanese, consistently good service.
Sushi was delicious!! Went here with my mom and we were both very happy with the food quality! One of the best places in Vancouver for Sushi.

I brought my 92 yr old Dad there because they serve korrokke which we have not had in a while. He loved it! The staff were so gracious and helpful with his walker. The food was delicious, reasonable prices & fresh.  His main language is japanese ... at the home he is in there is no one else. They are not open at lunch.

Delicious food and fresh seafood.  I love their wasabi (I believe it is made in house!). Better to do takeout during busy hours, unless you don t mind going early or later than the dinner rush. Spicey salmon roll and special chopped scallops roll are my favourites here!
Traditional Japanese sushi. Stunning presentation and delicious!  Fresh and very high quality fish. Wonderfully warm and cozy atmosphere. A must try for sushi lovers!

My wife and I found this place through an article in the Vancouver Sun several months back, and its been our favourite Japanese restaurant since. Great service and high quality food. Mind you, they mostly specialize in sushi, so dont expect a long menu with everything. The restaurant is rather small so try and be there early if you can. For parties larger than 4, its a good idea to call ahead as theyll need to join tables.

Authentic sushi place run by the Japanese man behind the sushi counter. They use real wasabi and ginger that does not have food colouring. Service is attentive, and the menu has a good selection for both sushi and non sushi dishes. This is my personal go to place in the neighbourhood, and probably for many others as the small place can fill up fast.
Yummy!  Try the raw salmon rolls and nigiri as the salmon is great quality.  You can taste the difference.  Great sushi made by veteran in Japanese restaurant business.  Delicious authentic flavours.

Delicious and authentic as promised. No weird old tasting fishy aftertaste unlike many restaurants I go to. Service is polite and friendly without being overbearing. The chef and owner treats his staff well and smiles the whole time. You can tell he enjoys and takes pride in what he does.

I realized I never reviewed this place! I go as often as I can since I live so close. They have excellent sushi and a range of more hearty donburi, tempura and the like. Best chirashidon in the city, but whatever you order you cant go wrong. It is a small place and gets quite busy so I usually go for lunch on the weekend. They also have a good deal on weekends: kareage and beer for under $10 (I forgot the exact price). Afterall: day drinking is what weekends were made for!

We visit Kazu quite regularly and love it. Japanese owned and operated. The food is affordable and great selection of seafood. The grilled Kama is a must have here. They have a beer and karaage special for <$10 as a standing special
Super cool little sushi place with a lot of Japanese customers, great staff, great food!

Our go to neighbourhood sushi spot for both takeout and dine in. It s a hole in the wall authentic Japanese sushi with ambience that feels to me distinctly Japanese. Food: top notch, always fresh, high quality sushi and the rice has the perfect tanginess. They use real wasabi! I always get the deluxe assorted sushi if we are there for dinner. Their lunch boxes are very reasonable. Japanese ambience: Chef Kazu is at the sushi bar and you can watch him work his magic if you sit at the sushi bar. You can sometimes see his old friends swing by for a meal and a chat like my dad used to do at his friend s sushi bar so it s nostalgic to me. The music is usually bossa nova or something jazzy which at first doesn t seem Japanese but bossa nova music is extremely popular in Japan. My guess is that the owner is a huge bossa nova fan. Love the written menu items taped on the wall. Just the perfect hole in the wall gem. When ordering takeout, call early.

Small restaurant, Japanese owned. Friendly service, including from chef Kazu, who always says goodbye to you after your meal. Prices are comparable to other sushi places, but this is by far my favourite in the area.
Good quality and fresh fish. They use real wasabi!

One of the most authentic japanese restaurants ive eaten at here in Vancouver. Theyre food is amazing. The menu isnt as big as most but Its definitely quality over quantity. The service is great! And the food feels and taste like its definitely made with care and the best ingredients. Its definitely more expensive than most Japan restaurants but you know youre paying for the best. My only problem is that it has really weird hours so ive definitely missed it a lot of times trying to visit. Definitely will recommend to any japanese cuisine lover or to anyone honestly.

Just went here based on the recomendations here - NOT disappointed. One of the best sushi places Ive been to in Metro Vancouver - and when you consider the very reasonable price - best value pick! Service was great (servers are Japanese) and the Sushi Chef is very friendly (go chiso sama deshita)! We made a reservation which was a good idea as the place was packed at 6:15 pm when we arrived (always a good sign).  You can park at the nearby Safeway if you cant find any free street parking. One interesting feature which I loved was their authentic wasabi (as opposed to the usual paste you get everywhere else). Everything we ordered was delicious - melt in your mouth goodness. In addition my son ordered a side of tonkatsu and it was also really good - juicy pork just like in Japan.  This was our first visit and well definately be back - only 5 minutes east of the 2nd Narrows Bridge in Burnaby Heights

I appreciate Japanese-run restaurants for their unique menu items and for the extra care put into their dishes. Having native expertise in how a cuisine should taste is an advantage. These days dining out means paying for someone else to cook and not much more, but Kazu was a memorable dining experience. Some suggestions for improvement: -adding 2 extra nori to the takowasa -grilled smelt rather than deepfried (this could just be a preference)

Give your taste buds a treat. This restaurant will wow you with perfect, simple sushi. Everything was perfect from food to music. Service was great too. Real wasabi used. Seems like the restaurant is a passion project.

Tastes more authentic than a lot of other places in Vancouver. You can really taste the wasabi. Someone said it was real, but I havent confirmed it. I think they put a tad too much in the rolls though.

Kazu is an authentic Japanese run restaurant located in North Burnaby. Everyone from the waiters to the sushi chefs are Japanese. Their service and care for food is definitely different than what you would find at your local sushi joints. We arrived just past 6:00PM on a Friday night. The place was pretty packed with a couple of reserved tables left empty. We were greeted immediately upon entering and asked how many we had in our party. There was a group ahead of us when we arrived but we were both seated fairly quickly (within 5 mins). The restaurant itself is relatively small that seats about 30-35 people at maximum occupancy so there is likely going to be a wait during peak hours. After being seated, we were served with our menus and green tea. The first thing we noticed was that the tea is not your typical powdered green tea. It had a fully body to it and tasted great. The staff are really attentive and as soon as we shut our menus, there was a staff eager to take our order. We ordered the Kazu Maki, Yam Tempura Roll, and Tonkatsu. The food came relatively quickly (about 10 mins for the Kazu Maki and everything else within 15 mins). The presentation was great but the best thing was the absolute clean taste of each dish. It is seldom that you get the opportunity to really taste the different flavours stand out individually in each dish. Nothing mushed together in a mess and everything tasted awesome. The Kazu Maki was tasted fresh. The ingredients that went into it were all high quality and this was evident in the taste. The Yam Tempura Roll is lightly battered and lightly fried before they put in the roll (along with sprouts and mayo). The yam had a nice bite and wasnt mushy at all. The Tonkatsu was absolutely amazing. The pork cutlet was fried to a perfect crisp but left the meat inside tender and juicy. Best of all, it was not greasy and was thick. Seldom can you really taste what youre eating when you order tonkatsu as it is generally all pretty thin and fried to oblivion but this was not the case. The pork taste was evident and it was phenomenal. It came with the tonkatsu sauce that was nice and thick as well as some vegetables that provided a change in texture and cleaned your palette. Something that we noticed midway through the meal. The wasabi that is given looks to be hand grated (not the stuff you get from a tube). When we tried it, it was much different to the tubed wasabi. It didnt have that overpowering spice and was nice addition to the Kazu Maki. Overall, this place is a great choice for authentic Japanese cuisine that you can find locally. We would highly recommend this restaurant to any friends or family.

Awsome real original Japanese restaurant. not a fancy  decor but food is excellent. They use fresh wasabi on it. I love this wasabi spicy. However restaurant is cozy and small. You need to make a reservation before you visit.

Great authentic Japanese restaurant! This is our go to Japanese restaurant in the neighborhood! They serve real wasabi here. I would highly suggest the chirashi don, it s excellently prepared and comes with conch meat too!
The best sushi Ive had in my life.
One of the very few Japanese restaurants actually owned by Japanese.  Very good and tasty Japanese food.  Portions are perfect, not too big, yet too small.  Its just perfect.  Friendly staff.

Best sashimi ever! This Japanese restaurant s salmon and tuna sashimi are so fresh you don t need soy sauce, because the quality of their ingredients is top notch. It s my favourite little hole in the wall! Highly recommend!
Fast, friendly service. Great food at a fair price! Will be back
Excellent experience all around. Intimate atmosphere with the sushi chefs visible working their magic. All the usual sushi items are top notch, as is the chicken karage. Highly recommended.
Very good Japanese restaurant. Good price, delicious dishes for those who appreciate traditional Japanese food. Nice and kind staff. Get there early on weekends. Very small place, it gets very busy.
Incredibly fresh sushi, great prices, attentive staff! 10/10 will be back. Be careful with the cold Sake, its so smooth youll think youre drinking water. :)

This place is a gem! Authentic Japanese run japanese place! The prices are reasonable, the menu offers a large selection with great daily specials and dinner specials. The girls working the service are very sweet and friendly which is very refreshing.

Good quality sushi. Traditional Japanese cooking. Would have preferred Hamachi back rather than belly though. When I get Hamachi belly all I taste is fat rather than the distinct flavourful taste of Hamachi.

Legit Japanese restaurant. Actually owned and operated by Japanese. Fresh quality sashimi, and actual real wasabi - none of that fake paste stuff out of a tube. For obvious reasons, this place gets busy. What a gem of North Burnaby.
I love this place. Its a authentic Japanese  restaurant with very fresh selection of sushi! I like their spicy tuna don, crazy Burnaby roll, fried chicken and their hamachi sashimi.
A quaint sushi restaurant in the Heart of Burnaby heights! One of our go to places whenever we are in the area. Chef Kazu is always smiling and food quality is consistent.

Really good food, great quality, good service and nice ambience. The staff is actually Japanese, so they have a selection of lesser known, more authentic choices on top of all the usual choices. Try it out; you wont be disappointed.
One of the best places for authentic Japanese sushi - Japanese owned and operated.  Top quality sushi at decent prices!

Ive been searching for a go to sushi restaurant on Hastings for quite a few months and Ive finally found it. Hands down, best sushi on Hastings. As a bonus to the already delicious food - great service.
Best sushi in Burnaby if not all of Vancouver by far. Authentic Japanese chefs with authentic Japanese service. Very very good!!!
Not a huge menu, but what they make they make well and authentically. Language barrier can exist when ordering from some of the staff, so confirm your order if youre unsure. Great fresh wasabi.
Quality sushi and sashimi!!! Love their deluxe sushi set!!! Cooked food is not as good as other Japanese restaurants though!
Very good place food is great and food is authentic Japanese food, wasabi is the real kind and waitresses are always making sure we have enough tea. Fantastic place!
I had the Tonkatsu entree, and the pork was tender and juicy. The atmosphere is also very nice. I would definitely come again!
Great service! Excellent donburi and sushi, and scallop is top notch. Decent prices for what you get. Would definitely recommend!
Amazing service! The foods always fabulous and i feel its all very authentic! My regular spot. The waitresss are so sweet so i always tip a little extra
Wonderful sushi carefully prepared. Nice and discrete service. Very fair prices. Strongly recommended. Complimenti
